alert.note: Alert for Norman (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 26 at 11:54PM CST until January 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Norman County. * WHEN...Until noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Very difficult to impossible travel conditions expected. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Worst conditions will occur in open country outside of sheltered areas.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
